snippet: Last year, new Hispanic high school graduates became more likely than their white counterparts to go directly to college, according to a study.
abstract: Pew Research Center finds that after lagging behind other Americans in education for generations, Latinos have significantly narrowed gap; finds that they passed milestone in 2012, with new Hispanic high school graduates more likely than their white counterparts to go directly to college.
lead_paragraph: Last year, new Hispanic high school graduates became more likely than their white counterparts to go directly to college, according to a study.

headline.main: As Latinos Make Gains in Education, Gaps Remain
headline.print_headline: As Latinos Make Gains In Education, Gaps Remain
